00075 void EnsureIdentifiersInitialized() {
00076   printf("void EnsureIdentifiersInitialized() {\n");
00077   static bool identifiers_initialized = false;
00078   if (identifiers_initialized)
00079     return;
00080   
00081   browser->getstringidentifiers(plugin_property_identifier_names,
00082                                 NUM_PROPERTY_IDENTIFIERS,
00083                                 plugin_property_identifiers);
00084   browser->getstringidentifiers(plugin_method_identifier_names,
00085                                 NUM_METHOD_IDENTIFIERS,
00086                                 plugin_method_identifiers);
00087   identifiers_initialized = true;
00088 }

00092 std::string CreateStringFromNPVariant(const NPVariant& variant) {
00093   printf("std::string CreateStringFromNPVariant(const NPVariant& variant) {\n");
00094   return std::string(NPVARIANT_TO_STRING(variant).UTF8Characters,
00095                      NPVARIANT_TO_STRING(variant).UTF8Length);
00096 }

00100 static bool StoreHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {
00101   printf("static bool StoreHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {      \n");
00102   std::string s_key = CreateStringFromNPVariant(key);
00103   std::string s_val = CreateStringFromNPVariant(val);
00104 
00105   printf("----------------------------------\n");
00106   printf("key: %s\n", s_key.c_str());
00107   printf("len(val) == %d\n", s_val.size());
00108                                         
00109   // store a hex encoded value.
00110   HEX_STORE.Store(s_key, s_val);
00111   if (!HEX_STORE.Ok())
00112     printf("HEXSTORE ERROR: %d\n", HEX_STORE.Err());
00113   return true;
00114 }
00115 
00116 static bool AppendHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {
00117   printf("static bool AppendHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {\n");
00118   std::string s_key = CreateStringFromNPVariant(key);
00119   std::string s_val = CreateStringFromNPVariant(val);      
00120 
00121   printf("Appending Store ----------------------------------\n");
00122   printf("key: %s\n", s_key.c_str());
00123 
00124   HEX_STORE.Append(s_key, s_val);
00125 
00126   if (HEX_STORE.Ok()){
00127     printf("len(val) == %d\n", HEX_STORE.ValLength(s_key));
00128     printf("decoding: %s\n", HEX_STORE.ByteArray(s_key));
00129   } else {
00130     HEX_STORE.ReportErr();
00131   } 
00132   return true;
00133 }

00136 static bool FortyTwo(const _NPVariant result) {
00137   printf("static bool FortyTwo(const _NPVariant result) {\n");
00138   std::string s = CreateStringFromNPVariant(result);
00139   s += "\n";
00140   printf(s.c_str());
00141   return true;
00142 }

00144 // This function creates a string in the browser's memory pool and then returns
00145 // a variable containing a pointer to that string.  The variable is later
00146 // returned back to the browser by the Invoke() function that called this.
00147 static bool HelloWorld(NPVariant *result) {
00148   printf("static bool HelloWorld(NPVariant *result) {\n");
00149   if (result) {
00150     const char *msg = "hello, world. soon to be img.";
00151     const int msg_length = strlen(msg) + 1;
00152     // Note: |msg_copy| will be freed later on by the browser, so it needs to
00153     // be allocated here with NPN_MemAlloc().
00154     char *msg_copy = reinterpret_cast<char*>(NPN_MemAlloc(msg_length));
00155     strncpy(msg_copy, msg, msg_length);
00156     STRINGN_TO_NPVARIANT(msg_copy, msg_length - 1, *result);
00157   }
00158   return true;
00159 }

00161 // Helper functions ------------------------------------------------------------
00162 
00163 bool TestGetProperty(PluginObject* obj,
00164                      const NPVariant* args, uint32_t arg_count,
00165                      NPVariant* result) {
00166   printf("bool TestGetProperty(PluginObject* obj,\n");
00167   if (arg_count == 0)
00168     return false;
00169 
00170   NPObject *object;
00171   browser->getvalue(obj->npp(), NPNVWindowNPObject, &object);
00172 
00173   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < arg_count; i++) {
00174     assert(NPVARIANT_IS_STRING(args[i]));
00175     std::string property_string = CreateStringFromNPVariant(args[i]);
00176     NPIdentifier property_identifier =
00177         browser->getstringidentifier(property_string.c_str());
00178 
00179     NPVariant variant;
00180     bool retval = browser->getproperty(obj->npp(), object, property_identifier,
00181                                        &variant);
00182     browser->releaseobject(object);
00183 
00184     if (!retval)
00185       break;
00186 
00187     if (i + 1 < arg_count) {
00188       assert(NPVARIANT_IS_OBJECT(variant));
00189       object = NPVARIANT_TO_OBJECT(variant);
00190     } else {
00191       *result = variant;
00192       return true;
00193     }
00194   }
00195 
00196   VOID_TO_NPVARIANT(*result);
00197   return false;
00198 }

00203   printf("NPObject* PluginAllocate(NPP npp, NPClass* the_class) {\n");
00204   EnsureIdentifiersInitialized();
00205   PluginObject* newInstance = new PluginObject(npp);
00206   return reinterpret_cast<NPObject*>(newInstance);

00219 bool PluginHasMethod(NPObject* obj, NPIdentifier name) {
00220   printf("bool PluginHasMethod(NPObject* obj, NPIdentifier name) {\n");
00221   for (int i = 0; i < NUM_METHOD_IDENTIFIERS; i++) {
00222     if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[i])
00223       return true;
00224   }
00225   return false;
00226 }
00227 
00228 bool PluginInvoke(NPObject* header,
00229                   NPIdentifier name,
00230                   const NPVariant* args, uint32_t arg_count,
00231                   NPVariant* result) {
00232   printf("bool PluginInvoke(NPObject* header,\n");
00233   PluginObject* plugin = reinterpret_cast<PluginObject*>(header);
00234                 
00235   if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_TEST_GET_PROPERTY]) {
00236     return TestGetProperty(plugin, args, arg_count, result);                    
00237   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_SET_TEXT_BOX]) {
00238     if (1 == arg_count && NPVARIANT_IS_OBJECT(args[0])) {
00239       //return event_handler->set_text_box(NPVARIANT_TO_OBJECT(args[0]));
00240     }
00241 
00242   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_MODULE_READY]) {
00243     INT32_TO_NPVARIANT(1, *result);
00244     return true;
00245                         
00246   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_REPORT_CHECKSUM]) {
00247     //return event_handler->addText(plugin->ReportChecksum().c_str());
00248                         
00249   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_CHECKSUM_CHECK_SUCCESS]) {
00250     BOOLEAN_TO_NPVARIANT(plugin->IsChecksumCheckSuccess(), *result);
00251     return true;
00252 
00253   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_HELLOWORLD]) {
00254     return HelloWorld(result);
00255                         
00256   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_FORTYTWO]) {
00257     return FortyTwo(args[0]);
00258 
00259   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_STORE_HEX]) {
00260     return StoreHex(args[0], args[1]);
00261 
00262   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_APPEND_HEX]) {
00263     return AppendHex(args[0], args[1]);
00264   }
00265 
00266   return false;
00267 }

00312 // Bitmap painting -------------------------------------------------------------
00313 // Ugly gradient filled rectangle.
00314 void DrawSampleBitmap(NPDeviceContext2D* context, int width, int height) {
00315   printf("void DrawSampleBitmap(NPDeviceContext2D* context, int width, int height) {\n");
00316   int stride = context->stride;
00317   unsigned char* buffer = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(context->region);
00318   static const int kPixelStride = 4;
00319 
00320   if (0 == height || 0 == width)
00321     return;
00322 
00323   static const float kVStep = 1.0 / static_cast<float>(height);
00324   static const float kHStep = 1.0 / static_cast<float>(width);
00325   static const float kAlphaStep = 1.0 / static_cast<float>(width + height);
00326   for (int i = 0; i < height; ++i) {
00327     for (int j = 0; j < width; ++j) {
00328       int index = i * stride + j * kPixelStride;
00329       float alpha = 1.0 - (i + j) * kAlphaStep;
00330       float red = i * kVStep;
00331       float green = j * kHStep;
00332       // BGRA, premultiplied alpha.
00333       buffer[index + 0] = 0x00;
00334       buffer[index + 1] = static_cast<unsigned char>(green * alpha * 255);
00335       buffer[index + 2] = static_cast<unsigned char>(red * alpha * 255);
00336       buffer[index + 3] = static_cast<unsigned char>(alpha * 255);
00337     }
00338   }
00339 }
00340 
00341 uint32_t HexStringToUInt(std::string hex_str) {
00342   printf("uint32_t HexStringToUInt(std::string hex_str) {\n");
00343   static const int hex_base = 16;
00344   uint64_t res = strtoul(hex_str.c_str(), NULL, hex_base);
00345 #if __LP64__
00346   // Long is 64-bits, we have to handle under/overflow ourselves.  Test to see
00347   // if the result can fit into 32-bits (as signed or unsigned).
00348   if (static_cast<int32_t>(static_cast<int64_t>(res)) !=
00349       static_cast<int64_t>(res) &&
00350       static_cast<uint32_t>(res) != res) {
00351     res = kuint32max;
00352   }
00353 #endif
00354   return static_cast<uint32_t>(res);
00355 }
00356 
00357 std::string Get2DImageChecksum(const NPDeviceContext2D* context) {
00358   printf("std::string Get2DImageChecksum(const NPDeviceContext2D* context) {\n");
00359   int row_count = context->dirty.bottom - context->dirty.top;
00360   int stride = context->dirty.right - context->dirty.left;
00361   static const int kPixelStride = 4;
00362   size_t length = row_count * stride * kPixelStride;
00363   MD5Digest md5_result;   // 128-bit digest
00364   MD5Sum(context->region, length, &md5_result);
00365   std::string hex_md5 = MD5DigestToBase16(md5_result);
00366   // Return the least significant 8 characters (i.e. 4 bytes)
00367   // of the 32 character hexadecimal result as an int.
00368   return hex_md5.substr(24);
00369 }

00376 NPExtensions* extensions = NULL;

00378 
00379 // Sine wave similar to one from simple_sources.cc
00380 // F is the desired frequency (e.g. 200), T is sample type (e.g. int16)
00381 template <int F, typename T> void SineWaveCallback(
00382     NPDeviceContextAudio *context) {
00383 
00384   const size_t n_samples  = context->config.sampleFrameCount;
00385   const size_t n_channels = context->config.outputChannelMap;
00386   const double th = 2 * 3.141592653589 * F / context->config.sampleRate;
00387   // store time value to avoid clicks on buffer boundries
00388   intptr_t t = (intptr_t)context->config.userData;
00389 
00390   T* buf = reinterpret_cast<T*>(context->outBuffer);
00391   for (size_t sample = 0; sample < n_samples; ++sample) {
00392     T value = static_cast<T>(sin(th * t++) * std::numeric_limits<T>::max());
00393     for (size_t channel = 0; channel < n_channels; ++channel) {
00394       *buf++ = value;
00395     }
00396   }
00397   context->config.userData = reinterpret_cast<void *>(t);
00398 }

00407 PluginObject::PluginObject(NPP npp)
00408     : npp_(npp),
00409       test_object_(browser->createobject(npp, GetTestClass())),
00410       device2d_(NULL),
00411       device3d_(NULL),
00412       pgl_context_(NULL),
00413       deviceaudio_(NULL) {
00414   memset(&context_audio_, 0, sizeof(context_audio_));
00415 }

00439 void PluginObject::New(NPMIMEType pluginType,
00440                        int16_t argc,
00441                        char* argn[],
00442                        char* argv[]) {
00443   printf("void PluginObject::New(NPMIMEType pluginType,\n");
00444   // Default to 2D rendering.
00445   dimensions_ = 2;
00446 
00447   for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
00448     if (strcmp(argn[i], "dimensions") == 0)
00449       dimensions_ = atoi(argv[i]);
00450   }
00451 
00452   if (!extensions) {
00453     browser->getvalue(npp_, NPNVPepperExtensions,
00454                       reinterpret_cast<void*>(&extensions));
00455     // CHECK(extensions);
00456   }
00457   device2d_ = extensions->acquireDevice(npp_, NPPepper2DDevice);
00458   if (device2d_ == NULL) {
00459     printf("Failed to acquire 2DDevice\n");
00460     exit(1);
00461   }
00462   //GAME.RegisterDevice2D(device2d_);
00463 
00464   device3d_ = extensions->acquireDevice(npp_, NPPepper3DDevice);
00465   if (device3d_ == NULL) {
00466     printf("Failed to acquire 3DDevice\n");
00467     exit(1);
00468   }
00469 
00470   deviceaudio_ = extensions->acquireDevice(npp_, NPPepperAudioDevice);
00471   if (deviceaudio_ == NULL) {
00472     printf("Failed to acquire AudioDevice\n");
00473     exit(1);
00474   }
00475 }

00481 
00482 void PluginObject::SetWindow(const NPWindow& window) {
00483   printf("void PluginObject::SetWindow(const NPWindow& window) {\n");
00484   width_ = window.width;
00485   height_ = window.height;
00486 
00487   if (dimensions_ == 2) {
00488     NPDeviceContext2DConfig config;
00489     NPDeviceContext2D context;
00490     NPError err = device2d_->initializeContext(npp_, &config, &context);
00491     if (err != NPERR_NO_ERROR) {
00492       printf("Failed to initialize 2D context\n");
00493       exit(1);
00494     }
00495 
00496     context2d_ = &context;
00497     
00498     DrawSampleBitmap(&context, window.width, window.height);    
00499     plugin2d_checksum_ = HexStringToUInt(Get2DImageChecksum(&context));
00500     err = device2d_->getStateContext(npp_, &context,
00501                                      NPExtensionsReservedStateSharedMemoryChecksum,
00502                                      reinterpret_cast<intptr_t*>(&device2d_checksum_));
00503     if (err != NPERR_NO_ERROR) {
00504       printf("Failed to retrieve the 2D context checksum\n");
00505       exit(1);
00506     }
00507 
00508     // TODO(brettw) figure out why this cast is necessary, the functions seem
00509     // to match. Could be a calling convention mismatch?
00510     //NPDeviceFlushContextCallbackPtr callback =
00511     //reinterpret_cast<NPDeviceFlushContextCallbackPtr>(&FlushCallback);
00512     //device2d_->flushContext(npp_, &context, callback, NULL);
00513     device2d_->flushContext(npp_, &context, NULL, NULL);    
00514   }
00515   
00516   // Audio is only produced on the 2d version, because we embed two in the page.
00517   if (dimensions_ == 2 && !context_audio_.config.callback) {
00518     NPDeviceContextAudioConfig cfg;
00519     cfg.sampleRate       = 44100;
00520     cfg.sampleType       = NPAudioSampleTypeInt16;
00521     cfg.outputChannelMap = NPAudioChannelStereo;
00522     cfg.inputChannelMap  = NPAudioChannelNone;
00523     cfg.sampleFrameCount = 1024;
00524     cfg.startThread      = 1;  // Start a thread for the audio producer.
00525     cfg.flags            = 0;
00526     cfg.callback         = 0; //&SineWaveCallback<200, int16_t>; 
00527     NPError err = deviceaudio_->initializeContext(npp_, &cfg, &context_audio_);
00528 
00529 
00530     if (err != NPERR_NO_ERROR) {
00531       printf("Failed to initialize audio context\n");
00532       exit(1);
00533     }
00534   }
00535   //GAME
00536   
00537 }

00544 bool PluginObject::IsChecksumCheckSuccess() {
00545   printf("bool PluginObject::IsChecksumCheckSuccess() {\n");
00546   if (device2d_checksum_ != plugin2d_checksum_)
00547     return false;
00548   return true;
00549 }
00550 
00551 std::string PluginObject::ReportChecksum() {
00552   printf("std::string PluginObject::ReportChecksum() {\n");
00553   std::ostringstream output;
00554   if (device2d_checksum_ == plugin2d_checksum_) {
00555     output << "Checksums matched\n";
00556   } else {
00557     output << "ERROR: Failed to match device and plugin checksums\n";
00558   }
00559   output << "Device checksum:" << device2d_checksum_ << "\n";
00560   output << "Plugin checksum:" << plugin2d_checksum_ << "\n";
00561   return output.str();
00562 }
